findings.title: SQL Injection in google-gruyere.appspot.com
findings.description: SQL Injection vulnerability found in parameter.
findings.impact: This vulnerability has a critical impact, potentially allowing full system compromise, unauthorized access to highly sensitive data, or complete application takeover.
reproduction: Insert the payload ' OR EXTRACTVALUE(1, CONCAT(0x7e, (SELECT @@version), 0x7e)) -- - into the parameter
Submit the form or trigger the action
findings.evidence:
Payload: ' OR EXTRACTVALUE(1, CONCAT(0x7e, (SELECT @@version), 0x7e)) -- -
Detected using error method.
findings.remediation: Use parameterized queries or prepared statements instead of dynamically building SQL queries. Implement proper input validation.

findings.title: Authentication/Session Vulnerability in google-gruyere.appspot.com
findings.description: Session cookies are missing important security flags: SameSite.
findings.impact: This vulnerability has a high impact, potentially allowing significant data exposure, partial application compromise, or unauthorized access to sensitive functionality.
findings.remediation: Set the HttpOnly flag to prevent client-side script access to cookies. Set the Secure flag to ensure cookies are only sent over HTTPS. Set the SameSite attribute to 'Lax' or 'Strict' to prevent CSRF attacks.

findings.title: Authentication/Session Vulnerability in google-gruyere.appspot.com
findings.description: Session cookies are missing important security flags: Secure.
findings.impact: This vulnerability has a high impact, potentially allowing significant data exposure, partial application compromise, or unauthorized access to sensitive functionality.
findings.remediation: Set the HttpOnly flag to prevent client-side script access to cookies. Set the Secure flag to ensure cookies are only sent over HTTPS. Set the SameSite attribute to 'Lax' or 'Strict' to prevent CSRF attacks.
